ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned the general history of Ancient Egypt up until 1200 BCE or through the 18th Dynasty. This was primarily learned through case studies of the major archeological sites from each time period in chronological order through the 18th Dynasty. Through the final paper students could develop their research and research paper writing skills as well.
learned a lot about egyptian archeaology
I learned a lot about Ancient Egypt which is helpful as I before didn't know anything about the history of that part of the World, besides what I've seen in movies like The Mummy.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I enjoyed this course but wish there was more structure to each lecture, either consisting of a clear outline at the start of each class or focusing on a specific topic for each class. I found the lectures sometimes difficult to follow currently.

This course covers a lot of very interesting sites. The professor does a great job of adding historical context while still emphasizing the artifacts. The student presentations add a nice change of pace to the class as well. It might be nice to have more time to discuss the content in class as a seminar format.

A strength of this course is the ease of it as a simple lecture twice a week with no weekly assignments, just learning and note taking. Each class is a powerpoint available on Canvas and very organized from the start of the semester so it is very easy to follow. A weakness of it could be the lack of student participation as even though it is a small class of only about 15 kids there is no real participation it is taught as a lecture.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course to anyone interested in archeology/Egypt or is looking for a not stressful class.
Yes! This is a very enjoyable course for anyone interested in Ancient Egypt or archeology. The lectures are engaging and very informative. The content is really cool!

I would recommend this course to another student if they are interested in the history of Ancient Egypt as it provides a good overview of it from an archeological standpoint. It is also not a heavy workload at all so not much time need be spent on the class outside of it.
Yes, because it is interesting and well-taught.
